column4: Is there an Ubuntu packager online by any chance for a question?
are you looking to get involved with packaging?
if so, #ubuntu-motu is the place to go
but whats up? i might be able to answer your question
Ah, I would, but that's not the question ;) But I guess ub-motu is the place to go
well i do some packaging, so if you'd like i can try to answer
I would like to have an ubuntu package for (suckless's) surf tar.gz. I would like to give it a go myself, but that would take ages to learn. Is there a way to propose that tar.gz to be packaged?
yep, you can file a bug
and it doesnt take ages :) its not too bad really, though that kinda depends on how complicated the software you're packaging is
I can't even solve the dependancies by hand installing tarballs ;) (yes I tried)
the INSTALL file should help if there is one. also, "apt-file search $filename" (apt-file is not installed by default) can lookup what package contains the file you're missing for compiling against
damn... now you make me anxious to try again...
I'll check out launchpad just to be on the safe side ;) Did you package a lot?
i dont often do packages from scratch. usually it's packaging a new release or integrating a patch into a package
cool. I read about packaging often, and I like the stories of the Motu, but the threshold of going from reading tutorial, and actually trying it I still didn't take.
have you seen the motu packaging 101 videos daniel holbach has on youtube? theyre easy to follow along with
I think I did yes. Maybe I should just take the plunge ;) Is there a mailinglist of some sort motu use?
yes, and i should get around to joining it since ive been one nearly a month now
lists.ubuntu.com has all the mailing lists
thanks for the info maco. I'll keep you informed ;)
no problem :)
